column1: [Charania] From two PPG in high school to All-Conference standout in leading team to second round of NCAA tournament: Ohio junior guard Jason Preston is declaring for the 2021 NBA Draft, he tells TheAthletic and Stadium. He’ll maintain ability to return to school.
The LA Clippers knowing they didn’t have many future picks took advantage tonight and finished the draft with Keon Johnson, Jason Preston & Brandon Boston Jr
[Highlight] Clippers rookie Jason Preston with the acrobatics and the english
Clippers' rookie Jason Preston says Reggie Jackson has been at the facility every day that he's been in
[Esnaashari] The LA Clippers have officially signed Jason Preston and Brandon Boston.

Following the Clippers' signings of BJ Boston and Jason Preston to multi-year deals, Clippers reporter Andrew Greif responds to tweet: "Your instinct (that a [big] trade is coming) certainly feels right."
[Swanson] Jason Preston was a HS bench warmer planning to major in journalism. A last chance to impress re-routed him to the NBA. Now the 33rd pick is eager for the next chapter with the Clippers
Draft Day with Jason Preston | From the Heart
[Wojnarowski] The Clippers acquire Ohio's Jason Preston at No. 33 for a future second-round pick and cash, per source.
[Swanson] Clippers' rookie Jason Preston says Reggie Jackson has been at the facility every day that he's been in, as well as Luke Kennard, Terance Mann and Amir Coffey.
The Clippers now have 10 players 25 or younger: Terance Mann, Luke Kennard, Ivica Zubac, Amir Coffey, Justise Winslow, Harry Giles, Jay Scrubb, Keon Johnson,Jason Preston and Brandon Boston Jr.

[Esnaashari] LA Clippers announce that Nicolas Batum (personal reasons), Serge Ibaka (rehab), Keon Johnson (illness), Kawhi Leonard (rehab) and Jason Preston (right foot injury) are OUT for tomorrow's season opener against Golden State.

[Wojnarowski] Clippers rookie point guard Jason Preston had right foot surgery in Los Angeles today and is expected to miss a significant part of the season, sources tell ESPN. Preston was the 33rd pick in the July NBA Draft out of Ohio University.
